lines.text: You cold-gutted shark.
Ahh!... You're a flatterer.

Now then, me bullies! Would you rather do the gallows dance, and hang in chains 'til the crows pluck your eyes from your rotten skulls? Or would you feel the roll of a stout ship beneath your feet again?
There's none would be so loyal, nor fight so desperate, as cutthroats under sentence of death... if they knew that at the end of the voyage a royal pardon would be in their pockets.
I shall hold you responsible for their good conduct.
Between their conduct and mine, your majesty, there will be little to choose.
[Adam Mercy unearths a skull]
Who might this be?
Perhaps a man that asked too many questions.
[first lines]
Stab me, there's a pretty sight!
It'll be prettier still when the fire reaches the magazine, Captain.
Pity though. Lots of stout seamen among 'em. They've been with us a long time.
We can none of live forever, Mr. Boyle. Dead men don't talk.
Your neck will be stretched as long as your memory, one of these days.
Are we such callous rascals that we'd leave a dead comrade without commending his soul to his new master?
[the pirates gather around the dead man]
Here lieth one who through treachery and avarice would ahve placed in jeopardy the lives of honest men. And here may he lie forever in the sands of Madagascar. Rest in peace.
I'm one of nature's gentlemen, but I need polish, my good man. If I'm to improve myself...
A gentleman only employs the term "My good man" when addressing lower servants or his inferiors, sir.
You see...
[sucks his teeth]
...that's why I want you.
[sucks his teeth again]
With my upbringing...
A gentleman never sucks his teeth, sir. Many a man's social career has been ruined by less, sir.
Governor, would you be good enough to tell them what we're here for?
Give heed you-you vermin. Here's news to your advantage...
Is the hangman dead, then?
Out with it, Jock Nastyface! Is it that your mother's turned into an honest woman?
Silence you mutinous dogs! If another man speaks. I'll trice him up by the thumbs and flog him raw!
Tsk-tsk-tsk. Is that the way to win the love of these unfortunate gentleman?
Look you then! I want men with iron in their blood and steel in their sinews. And the first up here is the first enlisted!
May it please your Majesty, I accuse this man of piracy and murder!
Was ever a gentleman so misfortunate?
Lock him up in Newgate. He's to be held for the next session of the Court of Oyez and Terminer - there to be tried for his life.
[the palace guards grab Captain Kidd]
Hands off me, you scum! All I done was for the credit and for the honor and glory of England!
[from the scaffold]
greed that spawns murder; hatred that corrodes the soul; ambition - the foulest strumpet of all.

[to hangman]
Hey, Dick - Dick Kent. Sell me a bit of that rope for a sixpence will you?
Save your money, me lads. You can have it all for nothing if you'll only step here and wear it!
[to hangman]
Hurry up, Kent. Can't wait forever.
[last lines]
Captain Kidd is dead, my Lord Blayne. His account is closed. Now in what manner can I atone for the injustice I worked upon your father? Off with you, First Sea Lord. What do you suggest?
We've a fine frigate of 50 guns commissioned for American waters that we thought of naming the "Lady Anne."
It should be a wedding gift to you from the crown for your loyalty and service to King and Country.
But however we do it, it must be legal-like and honest.
Stick to ways you're familiar with.
Why, you pox-raddled villain, I can be as honest as any man if I have the incentive!
